reviews.review:
This is the funniest game ever made. No really, its humor is 100% perfect. The jokes are spot on, the characters delightful, and the situations hilarious. Gameplay wise, it is, as one would hopefully expect, a portal game. The mechanics are more or less the same as the first game, but with a few inclusions. The level editor and workshop support is a very nice addition, and has been used to its fullest, meaning that anybody who uses the map finder enough, will come to witness an entirely new story. 

I honestly do not care that much about the gameplay. Puzzle games are just not my thing, yet that is what makes this game so amazing. Even though I hate this genre, this is still probably one of my favorite games of all time, based purely on the characters.

I've played both the first and second games to this franchise a few times over. This is the best of the two, granted the first one is no puch over. Portal 2 llega justo cuando los amantes de la primera obra ya inmortal podían desearlo con más fuerza. El juego no solo amplía todo lo que "inventó" o llevó más arriba su antecesor, sino que consigue exprimir la lógica humana hasta tal punto que disfrutarlo de principio a fin nos hará replantearnos toda la filosofía que expone la saga: cómo las máquinas son capaces de retar al hombre. La nueva apariencia destartalada y destrozada de los laboratorios Aperture no hace más que multiplicar su variedad de situaciones, planteamiento menos cuadriculado de los retos y cambios de un escenario a otro, algo que se echaba de menos en la primera parte.

Portal 2 was way more detailed than the last Portal. There is some ups and downs; like the graphics of GLaDOS in Portal 1 compared to Portal 2's GLaDOS, but I guess thats because "the newer the game the better the graphics". Anyway, Portal 2 was longer and more challenging compared to the first one, which made it a lot more fun. Plot twists made this game even better. The gaps in the story line between Portal 1 and Portal 2 made it a bit hard to follow, but if you read some comics or websites they will explain most of the information. Overall, this was a great play and I recommend this game for anyone, it will provide hours of entertainment.

Good game, but way to scary for my tastes.

This game kept me guessing, laughing, and testing my brain throughout the entire journey through Aperture.  The jokes were very well thought up and whimsical, which often times forced me to push "pause" in order for me to regain my senses and hear what was going on at the time.  The Puzzles can get pretty challenging, but not impossible. (though sometimes you might feel that way when you get stumped on one)  The plot had a few twists that caught me off guard. 

Overall, this game is definitely worth the money, and I strongly recommend it for it's humor, gameplay, puzzles, graphics, and re-playablity value.

Alright this is mine review for this game. I bought portal 2 becouse i got a 90 percent coupon of it so i bought it and wow. This game is actually really good. This is a must buy game for anyone and its enjoyable from start to finnish. Excellent gameplay, story, graphics and voiceacting. Plus the puzzles are actually challenging. Raven out.

This game is a Masterpiece ... Since Portal was a huge success, Portal 2 was a sure hit.
 
  Anyone can play it, because it that simple and fun, the only complex part is to use your intelligence to figure out each puzzle, some took me more time to figure out. The atmosphere makes you feel helpless yet you know you can go on, the suspense makes sit on the edge of your seat when the intense music starts to play, the characters are spot on, Cave Johnson, GLaDOS, Wheatly and Chell (you) ...*SPOILER* The End is heartwarming, well after you realise that those 3 drones wont shoot you and start to play music. 
 
 The Physics of this game is astounding, and you will really enjoy shooting portals as much as the other person. I recommend this, so buy it if you didn't, get Portal if you haven't played it and continue with Portal 2
I'd rate it 96/100.
P.S. : One downfall, can't see your feet in the game.
Just remember: Robots are better than you, smarter than you and work harder than you!
great game it has an exellent story to it BUT if you want to understand the story you must get portal 1
Awesome
Love this game, still play single-player it however many years after release, and it still makes me laugh.

Just replayed this game for the... what, 6th time now? Once for every year, that sounds about right.

This game is STILL good. It is so polished, The puzzles are still incredibly well thought out, nothing ever felt unfair, and the writing... HOH THE WRITING! Even though I've heard the same jokes 6 times now (probably more for the times I played and didn't beat the game) and they still manage to crack me up. The music is stellar, really pushing across a techno-futuristic, but almost sterile vibe without ever coming across as overpowering. And boasting one of the most climactic endings I've ever played.

I think it's safe to say that this game is perfect. There is nothing wrong with this game, not even little things, it is just. Perfect.

Also Steven Merchant is too good for this earth. We are not worthy.
BEST GAME

It's without a doubt that Portal 2 is one of the best puzzle games of all time, and generally what you think of when you think of the genre Puzzle Game. My opinion on Portal is no different then anyone else's opinion, Portal is a great game with an interesting story, nice comedy, fantastic charaters, and some errieness to it all. The Multiplayer (if with a good player and are willing to listen to you and vice versa) is fantastic, while it gets troublesome at times, its usually nice and fine. All in all what can be said about Portal 2 that hasn't already been said? It's a great game.

I love Portal! One of Valve's best games

Even though this game was released in 2010, it is the most fun puzzle game I have ever played.
The single player storyline is great! The test chambers get much harder, but it is so much fun experimenting to see where that Portal is supposed to go. The one part of the single player story I just love, is the plot twist. Not going to say what it is. (You will have to see for yourself)

After completing the single player storyline, you can do co-op. You will probably need a friend, being that not many others do co-op these days. The co-op story features GlaDOS, who constantly reminds you in the tests they were originally supposed to be done by humans. The end of the co-op story though, has got to be the greatest ending for a co-op game ever. 

After completing the co-op and single player, you may think you are basically done with the game. WRONG. The community continues to create tons of maps, and even mods, to expand even the Portal 2 story, or even just fun chambers you can do. The one thing I just love about this game is the community. The community keeps on creating, making Portal 2 a joy to play, and see what awesome chambers were created, and which peek your interest. I'm sure you will find great maps, even created in Hammer, not just the in game test chamber creator. 

Overall, this game deserves a 10/10, for being a great puzzle game, and for having a great story, and huge community.

포탈1을 이은 속편이다. 포탈시리즈는 정말 재밌다. 특히 이번 2편에서는 좀더 긴 러닝타임, 멀티플레이, 맵 에디터등 포탈을 즐길수있는 모든 기능들이 포함되어있어서 강추하는 바이다. 물론 몇몇 아쉬운점이 있다. 예를 들면 스토리모드에서 좀.. 루즈한 부분이 있고, 멀티플레이는 제대로 작동하지 않는것 같다.(사람이 없어서 그런걸지도..)  심지어.. 2014년에 속편인 인디게임이 나왔는대..정확하지는 않지만 그내용이 충격이다..개인적으로는 포탈2 엔딩은 괜찮은 마무리였다. 그런대 그게 짝퉁? WTF! 여하튼 전체적으로는 매우매우 유니크한 작품이다.

This game is AWSOME! If you are the kind of person who loves challenges, and mental games, this one is perfect for you, and if you love the games with ALOT of secrets and UNREVEALED stories, you will love to play this game, while making your own theories about the game and its SECRET story!
The singleplayer campaign is awsome. the story is very simple, but the Secret story... well, you will need to pay alot of atention to the dialogs and the whole game, and parts of it, you will need to make your own theories.
Now, the multiplayer is awsome, you will be hours completing the multiplayer campaign with your friends! You will meet lots of new people! But, the campaign is very short. I think Valve should add some EXTRA levels every week, but the good thing is you can create your own levels.
If you are one of those guys that hate waiting, or that are impatient and/or silly, dont buy it, just buy it if you are ppatient and know how to solve things.

I will give it a 9-10, or maybe a 95-100 because think of this, after you complete the game and the multiplayer campaign, there will not be so much to do, but there are some achievements you can try to complete.
